ground_truth: Jack points toward the settee, and Rose steps to the settee, then stretches out on it. Rose drapes one arm along the back of the settee, lays her hand on the pillow behind her head, and places her right hand near her temple. Smiling, Rose lowers her head and licks her lips. Jack peers over the top of his sketchpad, draws a line, and, looking from the paper to Rose, he sketches. Jack grins as he draws, runs his charcoal across the paper creating faint arcs, jerks his head to toss his hair out of his eyes, and adds details as he fleshes out the sketch. Jack smiles as he darkens a shadow under Rose's breasts, while Rose gazes at Jack as he draws. With his finger, Jack rubs various parts of the charcoal drawing, including Rose's hand, forehead, and face. Rose stares expressionless, and gradually, wrinkles form around her eyes, and she transforms into her older self. The crew members and Rose's granddaughter, Lizzie, stare at her, and Brock and Lizzie exchange smiles. Jack signs and dates the drawing, then blows on it, closes his sketchbook, and hands it to Rose. They kiss. Later, Rose writes on a sheet of paper, and Jack steps up to her. She hands him the case holding the Heart of the Ocean. Jack walks into the next room and slides the case into the safe. In the first-class smoking room, Lovejoy approaches Cal, who stands, as the Titanic moves slowly. On the bridge, the helmsman turns the ship's wheel as a ship's officer steps up to Captain Smith, who looks down as he stirs a slice of lemon in his tea, then walks off. Stepping back into Rose's suite, he blows on his hands, and wearing an evening dress, Rose joins him. Rose grabs Jack and pulls him through the sitting room toward a door. Lovejoy steps into the suite as Rose and Jack hurry into Rose's bedroom, and Rose closes the door. Lovejoy strides through the sitting room as Jack and Rose step through another door into a corridor. Lovejoy bursts into another room as Jack and Rose hurry down the corridor. Lovejoy opens a door and glimpses Jack and Rose, who walk faster, prompting Lovejoy to follow them. Jack and Rose run to an elevator, dash into the elevator, and the operator slides the grate shut. Lovejoy runs up to the elevator and slams his hands against the grate, and as the elevator descends, Lovejoy glares through glass at them. Rose raises her middle finger, then waves, and Lovejoy hurries to the staircase. The elevator opens, and Rose and Jack spill out as Lovejoy runs down a staircase while Jack and Rose scramble from the bottom of a different staircase. Jack bumps onto a food table.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Jack indicates toward the couch, and Rose steps to the couch, then extends out on it. Rose drapes one limb along the back of the couch, lays her hand on the cushion behind her head, and places her right hand near her temple. Grinning, Rose lowers her head and moistens her lips. Jack peers over the top of his sketchbook, draws a line, and, looking from the paper to Rose, he sketches. Jack smiles as he darkens a shadow under Rose's bosom, while Rose gazes at Jack as he draws. With his finger, Jack rubs various parts of the charcoal drawing, including Rose's hand, forehead, and face. Rose stares expressionless, and gradually, creases form around her eyes, and she transforms into her older self. In the first-class smoking room, Lovejoy approaches Cal, who stands, as the Titanic moves slowly. Stepping back into Rose's suite, he blows on his hands, and wearing an evening gown, Rose joins him. Rose grabs Jack and pulls him through the sitting room toward a door. Lovejoy steps into the suite as Rose and Jack hurry into Rose's bedroom, and Rose closes the door. Lovejoy strides through the sitting room as Jack and Rose step through another door into a hallway. Lovejoy bursts into another room as Jack and Rose hurry down the hallway. Lovejoy opens a door and glimpses Jack and Rose, who walk faster, prompting Lovejoy to follow them. Jack and Rose run to an elevator, dash into the elevator, and the operator slides the grate shut. Rose raises her middle finger, then waves, and Lovejoy hurries to the stairs. One arm is draped along the back of the settee by Rose, her hand is laid on the pillow behind her head, and her right hand is placed near her temple. Various parts of the charcoal drawing, including Rose's hand, forehead, and face, are rubbed by Jack with his finger. Rose stares expressionless, and gradually, wrinkles form around her eyes, and her older self is transformed into by her. Her is stared at by the crew members and Rose's granddaughter, Lizzie, and smiles are exchanged by Brock and Lizzie. The drawing is signed and dated by Jack, then it is blown on, his sketchbook is closed, and it is handed to Rose. A kiss is shared by them. Later, a sheet of paper is written on by Rose, and Jack steps up to her. The case holding the Heart of the Ocean is handed to him by her. The next room is walked into by Jack, and the case is slid into the safe by him. In the first-class smoking room, Lovejoy approaches Cal, who stands, as the Titanic moves slowly. On the bridge, the ship's wheel is turned by the helmsman as a ship's officer steps up to Captain Smith, who looks down as a slice of lemon is stirred in his tea by him, and then he walks off. Stepping back into Rose's suite, his hands are blown on by him, and wearing an evening dress, she joins him. Jack is grabbed by Rose and is pulled through the sitting room toward a door. Lovejoy steps into the suite as the bedroom door is hurried into by Rose and Jack, and the door is closed by Rose. Through the sitting room strides Lovejoy as another door is stepped through by Jack and Rose into a corridor. Another room is burst into by Lovejoy as the corridor is hurried down by Jack and Rose. A door is opened by Lovejoy, and glimpses of Jack and Rose are caught by him, who walk faster, prompting them to be followed by him. The elevator is run to by Jack and Rose, the elevator is dashed into, and the grate is slid shut by the operator. Lovejoy runs up to the elevator, his hands are slammed against the grate by him, and as the elevator descends, they are glared at through glass by Lovejoy. Her middle finger is raised, then a wave is given by Rose, and the staircase is hurried to by Lovejoy. The elevator opens, and Rose and Jack spill out as a staircase is run down by Lovejoy while a different staircase's bottom is scrambled from by Jack and Rose. A food table is bumped onto by Jack.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Jack gestures to the settee, where Rose lies down, draping one arm along the back and placing her hand near her temple. She smiles, lowers her head, and licks her lips. Jack sketches, glancing up from his sketchpad, smiling as he draws and adds details, darkening shadows under Rose's breasts. Rose gazes at him, expressionless, as wrinkles form around her eyes, transforming her into her older self. The crew and her granddaughter, Lizzie, watch, with Brock and Lizzie exchanging smiles. Jack signs and dates the drawing, blows on it, closes his sketchbook, and hands it to Rose, and they kiss. Later, Rose writes, handing Jack the Heart of the Ocean case. He places it into a safe. In the first-class smoking room, Lovejoy approaches Cal. On the bridge, Captain Smith, stirring lemon into his tea, walks off. In Rose's suite, Jack and Rose, now in an evening dress, hurry through the sitting room as Lovejoy enters. They dash into Rose's bedroom and exit into a corridor. Lovejoy follows, catching a glimpse of them, prompting him to chase. They run to an elevator, rush inside, and the operator closes the grate. Lovejoy slams against it, glaring as the elevator descends. Rose raises her middle finger, waves, and Lovejoy rushes to the staircase. The elevator opens, and Jack and Rose spill out, while Lovejoy takes another staircase. Jack bumps into a food table.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Jack gestures to the settee, where Rose reclines, draping one arm along its back, with her hand near her head as she smiles and licks her lips. Jack sketches, occasionally tossing his hair back, smiling as he darkens shadows under Rose's breasts. Rose gazes at him, her expression shifting until wrinkles appear, transforming her into her older self. Crew members and Rose's granddaughter, Lizzie, watch with Brock, exchanging smiles. Jack signs and dates the drawing, hands it to Rose, and they kiss. Later, Rose writes, gives Jack the Heart of the Ocean case, which he locks in a safe. In the first-class smoking room, Lovejoy approaches Cal. On the bridge, an officer approaches Captain Smith, who stirs lemon in his tea. Back in Rose's suite, she takes Jack's hand as they move through rooms to evade Lovejoy, who chases them. Jack and Rose run to an elevator, leaving Lovejoy staring through the glass as they descend. Rose gestures rudely at him before they exit and scramble from a staircase, with Jack bumping into a food table.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Jack gestures toward the elegant settee, and with gentle steps, Rose moves gracefully over to it, before reclining comfortably on its plush surface. Rose elegantly drapes one arm leisurely along the back of the settee, allowing her hand to rest lightly on the pillow positioned just behind her head, while her right hand finds a place near her temple. With a soft, inviting smile, Rose lowers her head slightly and gently licks her lips. Jack, peering intently over the top of his sketchpad, carefully draws a line, casting his gaze back and forth between the paper and Rose as he diligently sketches her form. Grinning with satisfaction as he draws, Jack moves his hand confidently, allowing the charcoal to glide across the paper, creating delicate arcs, while he also gives his head a quick shake to toss his hair out of his eyes, meticulously adding details to bring the sketch to life. Jack continues to smile with pleasure as he deepens the shadow beneath Rose's breasts. Meanwhile, Rose fixates her gaze on Jack, watching him intently as he works. Using his finger, Jack gently rubs various sections of the charcoal drawing, focusing on areas like Rose's hand, forehead, and face to achieve the desired effect. Rose stares, expressionless, yet gradually, subtle wrinkles begin to form around her eyes, marking her transformation into her older self. The crew members, along with Rose's granddaughter, Lizzie, are captivated, and Brock and Lizzie exchange knowing smiles of affection. Jack carefreely signs and dates the finished drawing, then blows on it softly to set the charcoal, closes his sketchbook with a deliberate motion, and hands it to Rose with a gentle gesture. They share a tender kiss. Later, Rose finds herself writing thoughtfully on a sheet of paper, when Jack approaches her. She offers him the case containing the precious Heart of the Ocean. Jack then walks purposefully into the adjacent room and discreetly slides the precious case into the safe. Meanwhile, in the refined first-class smoking room, Lovejoy makes his way toward Cal, who is standing, as the majestic Titanic moves forward at a slow pace. On the bridge, the helmsman dutifully turns the ship's wheel while a ship's officer steps up to Captain Smith, who appears deep in thought as he stirs a slice of lemon in his tea, before he eventually walks off. Returning to Rose's elegantly decorated suite, he blows warm breaths on his hands to ward off the chill, and Rose, dressed in a stunning evening gown, joins him with an air of grace. With a playful energy, Rose grabs Jack by the hand and pulls him enthusiastically through the sitting room toward a nearby door. Lovejoy soon steps into the suite, just as Rose and Jack are hurrying into Rose's private bedroom, and Rose quickly closes the door behind them. Lovejoy strides determinedly through the sitting room, hot on their trail, as Jack and Rose discreetly step through another door and into a corridor beyond. Lovejoy bursts into another room, catching only a fleeting glimpse of Jack and Rose, which spurs him to quicken his pace in pursuit. Jack and Rose sprint to an elevator, quickly dashing inside, and the operator promptly slides the grate shut. Lovejoy races up to the elevator, slamming his hands against the grate in frustration, and as the elevator descends, Lovejoy glares intently through the glass at them. In a cheeky farewell, Rose raises her middle finger and waves goodbye, while Lovejoy rushes to the nearby staircase, determined not to lose them. As the elevator doors open, Rose and Jack spill out energetically while Lovejoy runs hastily down a staircase, and Jack and Rose swiftly scramble away from the bottom of a different staircase to avoid capture. In their haste, Jack bumps into a food table.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Jack, with a graceful motion of his hand, gestures invitingly toward the elegant settee, where Rose, taking gentle and deliberate steps, moves with an air of gracefulness toward it. She reclines comfortably on the plush, luxurious surface. With a sense of ease, Rose drapes one arm elegantly along the back of the settee, allowing her hand to rest lightly on the soft pillow positioned strategically just behind her head. Her right hand, meanwhile, finds a resting place near her temple. Accompanied by a soft, inviting smile, Rose inclines her head slightly downward and gently licks her lips. Jack, peering intently over the top of his sketchpad, begins to draw carefully, casting his gaze back and forth between the paper and Rose as he diligently sketches her form. With a grin of satisfaction, Jack moves his hand confidently, allowing the charcoal to glide smoothly across the paper, creating delicate arcs and lines, while he also gives his head a quick shake to toss his hair out of his eyes. He meticulously adds details, bringing the sketch to life with each stroke. Jack continues to smile with pleasure as he deepens the shadow beneath Rose's breasts. Meanwhile, Rose fixates her gaze intently on Jack, watching him as he works. With gentle precision, Jack uses his finger to rub various sections of the charcoal drawing, focusing on areas like Rose's hand, forehead, and face to achieve the desired effect. Rose stares at him, expressionless, yet gradually, subtle wrinkles begin to form around her eyes, marking her transformation into her older self. The crew members, along with Rose's granddaughter, Lizzie, find themselves captivated by the scene, and Brock and Lizzie exchange knowing smiles of affection. With a carefree motion, Jack signs and dates the finished drawing, then blows on it softly to set the charcoal, closes his sketchbook with a deliberate motion, and hands it to Rose with a gentle gesture. They share a tender, heartfelt kiss. Later, as Rose sits and writes thoughtfully on a sheet of paper, Jack approaches her. She offers him the case containing the precious Heart of the Ocean. Jack then walks purposefully into the adjacent room and discreetly slides the precious case into the safe. Meanwhile, in the refined first-class smoking room, Lovejoy makes his way toward Cal, who is standing, as the majestic Titanic moves forward at a slow, steady pace. On the bridge, the helmsman dutifully turns the ship's wheel while a ship's officer steps up to Captain Smith, who appears deep in thought, stirring a slice of lemon in his tea, before eventually walking off. Returning to Rose's elegantly decorated suite, Jack blows warm breaths on his hands to ward off the chill, and Rose, dressed in a stunning evening gown, joins him with an air of grace. With playful energy, Rose grabs Jack by the hand and pulls him enthusiastically through the sitting room toward a nearby door. Lovejoy soon steps into the suite just as Rose and Jack hurry into Rose's private bedroom, and Rose quickly closes the door behind them. Lovejoy strides determinedly through the sitting room, hot on their trail, as Jack and Rose discreetly step through another door and into a corridor beyond. Lovejoy bursts into another room, catching only a fleeting glimpse of Jack and Rose, which spurs him to quicken his pace in pursuit. Jack and Rose sprint to an elevator, quickly dashing inside, and the operator promptly slides the grate shut. Lovejoy races up to the elevator, slamming his hands against the grate in frustration, and as the elevator descends, Lovejoy glares intently through the glass at them. In a cheeky farewell, Rose raises her middle finger and waves goodbye, while Lovejoy rushes to the nearby staircase, determined not to lose sight of them. As the elevator doors open, Rose and Jack spill out energetically, while Lovejoy runs hastily down a staircase, and Jack and Rose swiftly scramble away from the bottom of a different staircase in a determined effort to avoid capture. In their haste, Jack bumps into a food table, creating a brief but notable commotion.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Jack gestures with his finger, pointing toward the settee, prompting Rose to gracefully make her way over to it. Upon reaching the settee, she carefully extends herself along its length, settling into a relaxed position. She elegantly drapes one arm along the backrest, letting her hand gently come to rest on the pillow positioned behind her head, while her right hand finds its place near her temple. With a soft smile playing on her lips, Rose gently lowers her head, moistening her lips with a subtle lick. Meanwhile, Jack peers intently over the edge of his sketchpad, capturing the scene before him. He draws a precise line, his gaze shifting back and forth from the paper to Rose as he commits her form to the page. A grin spreads across his face as he continues to draw, moving his charcoal in smooth arcs across the paper. Momentarily, he jerks his head, casually tossing his hair out of his eyes, maintaining his focus as he adds intricate details to bring the sketch to life. Jack's expression lights up with satisfaction as he darkens the shadow beneath Rose's breasts, his gaze meeting hers as she watches him work. With a deft touch, Jack uses his finger to rub and soften areas of the charcoal drawing, paying special attention to Rose's hand, forehead, and face. As Rose sits, her gaze fixed and unchanging, delicate wrinkles begin to emerge around her eyes, gradually transforming her into her older self. Observing this shift, the crew members and Rose's granddaughter, Lizzie, turn their attention toward her. Brock and Lizzie share a knowing smile. Jack concludes his artistic session by signing and dating the completed drawing, blowing gently to set the charcoal before he closes his sketchbook and offers it to Rose. In a moment of connection, they exchange a tender kiss. Later, Rose is seen writing on a sheet of paper, while Jack approaches her. With a meaningful gesture, she hands him the case containing the Heart of the Ocean. Jack then proceeds into the adjacent room, carefully sliding the case into the safety of the vault. Meanwhile, in the first-class smoking room, Lovejoy makes his way over to Cal, who stands observing the Titanic as it moves slowly through the water. On the bridge, the helmsman skillfully maneuvers the ship's wheel, while a ship's officer steps forward to join Captain Smith, who is momentarily preoccupied with stirring a slice of lemon in his tea before he strides away. Returning to Rose's suite, Jack blows warmth into his hands, preparing himself as Rose, dressed elegantly for the evening, joins him. She takes hold of Jack and leads him with urgency through the sitting room toward a door. As they do so, Lovejoy enters the suite, observing their hurried movement as Rose and Jack disappear into Rose's bedroom, quickly shutting the door behind them. Determined, Lovejoy strides through the room as Jack and Rose exit through another door, emerging into a narrow corridor. Not far behind, Lovejoy bursts into yet another room, catching sight of Jack and Rose as they pick up their pace, prompting him to give chase. Fleeing quickly, Jack and Rose make a beeline for an elevator, racing inside just as the operator slides the grate shut. Lovejoy reaches the elevator too late, slamming his hands against the metal barrier as he watches them descend, his glare piercing through the glass. In defiance, Rose raises her middle finger at him, following it with a wave. Undeterred, Lovejoy hurries toward the staircase. As the elevator doors part, Rose and Jack tumble out, making a hasty escape as Lovejoy rushes down the stairs. Meanwhile, Jack and Rose sprint away from the bottom of a different staircase, with Jack inadvertently colliding with a food table in their frantic dash.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Jack gestures toward the settee, prompting Rose to recline on it, positioning her arms comfortably while smiling and licking her lips. Observing Rose, Jack begins sketching, adding details and shading with focused concentration and small adjustments. As he works, Rose gazes at him, and with a gradual transformation, wrinkles appear, symbolizing her aging into her older self. The surrounding crew members, along with Rose's granddaughter Lizzie, watch her, with Brock and Lizzie exchanging knowing smiles. Jack completes the sketch with a signature, then hands it to Rose after blowing on it to set the charcoal. They share a kiss. Later, Rose writes a note and gives Jack the Heart of the Ocean case, which he secures in a safe in the next room.

As the Titanic proceeds, Lovejoy approaches Cal in the first-class smoking room. Meanwhile, on the bridge, a helmsman steers as an officer speaks briefly with Captain Smith, who then departs. Returning to Rose's suite, Jack, joined by Rose in an evening dress, is pulled by her through the sitting room. Lovejoy enters as they slip into Rose's bedroom, only to emerge through another door into a corridor. Lovejoy pursues them as they quicken their pace. Reaching an elevator, Jack and Rose dash inside, evading Lovejoy, who arrives just in time to see them descend. Rose taunts him with a gesture, prompting Lovejoy to rush down the stairs. As the elevator opens, Jack and Rose hastily exit and navigate through the area, with Jack colliding with a food table while Lovejoy races down a separate staircase.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Jack points toward the settee, a plush piece of furniture often used for lounging in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, and Rose steps to the settee, then stretches out on it. Rose drapes one arm along the back of the settee, lays her hand on the pillow behind her head, and places her right hand near her temple, a pose reminiscent of classic portrait styles. Smiling, Rose lowers her head and licks her lips. Jack peers over the top of his sketchpad, a tool used by artists to capture quick visual studies, draws a line, and, looking from the paper to Rose, he sketches. Jack grins as he draws, runs his charcoal across the paper creating faint arcs that hint at her form, jerks his head to toss his hair out of his eyes, and adds details as he fleshes out the sketch. Jack smiles as he darkens a shadow under Rose's breasts, emphasizing the contours of her figure, while Rose gazes at Jack as he draws. With his finger, Jack rubs various parts of the charcoal drawing, a technique used to create soft gradients, including Rose's hand, forehead, and face. Rose stares expressionless, and gradually, wrinkles form around her eyes, and she transforms into her older self, a reflection of the passage of time. The crew members and Rose's granddaughter, Lizzie, stare at her, and Brock and Lizzie exchange smiles, acknowledging the cherished memory. Jack signs and dates the drawing, then blows on it to set the charcoal, closes his sketchbook, and hands it to Rose. They kiss, sharing a moment of intimacy and connection. Later, Rose writes on a sheet of paper, possibly a letter or a personal note, and Jack steps up to her. She hands him the case holding the Heart of the Ocean, a fictional but legendary blue diamond said to be as valuable as the Hope Diamond. Jack walks into the next room and slides the case into the safe. In the first-class smoking room, a luxurious space exclusive to upper-class passengers on ships like Titanic, Lovejoy approaches Cal, who stands, as the Titanic, the famed ocean liner on its maiden voyage, moves slowly. On the bridge, the helmsman turns the ship's wheel as a ship's officer steps up to Captain Smith, the Titanic's real-life captain known for his experience and calm demeanor, who looks down as he stirs a slice of lemon in his tea, then walks off. Stepping back into Rose's suite, he blows on his hands, and wearing an evening dress, Rose joins him. Rose grabs Jack and pulls him through the sitting room toward a door. Lovejoy steps into the suite as Rose and Jack hurry into Rose's bedroom, and Rose closes the door. Lovejoy strides through the sitting room as Jack and Rose step through another door into a corridor, a narrow passage typical on ships. Lovejoy bursts into another room as Jack and Rose hurry down the corridor. Lovejoy opens a door and glimpses Jack and Rose, who walk faster, prompting Lovejoy to follow them. Jack and Rose run to an elevator, a relatively new invention at the time that revolutionized vertical transport, dash into the elevator, and the operator slides the grate shut. Lovejoy runs up to the elevator and slams his hands against the grate, and as the elevator descends, Lovejoy glares through glass at them. Rose raises her middle finger, a gesture widely understood as a sign of defiance, then waves, and Lovejoy hurries to the staircase. The elevator opens, and Rose and Jack spill out as Lovejoy runs down a staircase while Jack and Rose scramble from the bottom of a different staircase. Jack bumps onto a food table, disrupting the neatly arranged dishes.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. In the firstclass smoking room Lovejoy approaches Cal who stands as the Titanic moves slowly. On the bridge the helmsman turns the ship's wheel as a ship's officer steps up to Captain Smith who looks down as he stirs a slice of lemon in his tea then walks off. Stepping back into Rose's suite he blows on his hands and wearing an evening dress. Rose joins him. Rose grabs Jack and pulls him through the sitting room toward a door. Rose raises her middle finger then waves and Lovejoy hurries to the staircase. The elevator opens and Rose and Jack spill out as Lovejoy runs down a staircase while Jack and Rose scramble from the bottom of a different staircase. Jack bumps onto a food table.

High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In the firstclass smoking room Lovejoy approaches Cal who stands as the Titanic moves slowly. On the bridge the helmsman turns the ship's wheel as a ship's officer steps up to Captain Smith who looks down as he stirs a slice of lemon in his tea then walks off. Stepping back into Rose's suite he blows on his hands and wearing an evening dress. Rose joins him. Rose grabs Jack and pulls him through the sitting room toward a door. Lovejoy steps into the suite as Rose and Jack hurry into Rose's bedroom and Rose closes the door. Lovejoy strides through the sitting room as Jack and Rose step through another door into a corridor. Lovejoy bursts into another room as Jack and Rose hurry down the corridor. Lovejoy opens a door and glimpses Jack and Rose who walk faster prompting Lovejoy to follow them. Jack and Rose run to an elevator dash into the elevator and the operator slides the grate shut. Lovejoy runs up to the elevator and slams his hands against the grate and as the elevator descends Lovejoy glares through glass at them. Rose raises her middle finger then waves and Lovejoy hurries to the staircase. The elevator opens and Rose and Jack spill out as Lovejoy runs down a staircase while Jack and Rose scramble from the bottom of a different staircase. Jack bumps onto a food table.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Jack points toward the settee and Rose steps to the settee then stretches out on it. Rose drapes one arm along the back of the settee lays her hand on the pillow behind her head and places her right hand near her temple. Smiling Rose lowers her head and licks her lips. Jack peers over the top of his sketchpad draws a line and looking from the paper to Rose he sketches. Jack grins as he draws runs his charcoal across the paper creating faint arcs jerks his head to toss his hair out of his eyes and adds details as he fleshes out the sketch. Jack smiles as he darkens a shadow under Rose's breasts while Rose gazes at Jack as he draws. With his finger Jack rubs various parts of the charcoal drawing including Rose's hand forehead and face. Lovejoy bursts into another room as Jack and Rose hurry down the corridor. Lovejoy opens a door and glimpses Jack and Rose who walk faster prompting Lovejoy to follow them. Jack and Rose run to an elevator dash into the elevator and the operator slides the grate shut. Lovejoy runs up to the elevator and slams his hands against the grate and as the elevator descends Lovejoy glares through glass at them. Rose raises her middle finger then waves and Lovejoy hurries to the staircase. The elevator opens and Rose and Jack spill out as Lovejoy runs down a staircase while Jack and Rose scramble from the bottom of a different staircase. Jack bumps onto a food table.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Jack points toward the settee and Rose steps to the settee then stretches out on it. Rose drapes one arm along the back of the settee lays her hand on the pillow behind her head and places her right hand near her temple. Smiling Rose lowers her head and licks her lips. Rose raises her middle finger then waves and Lovejoy hurries to the staircase. The elevator opens and Rose and Jack spill out as Lovejoy runs down a staircase while Jack and Rose scramble from the bottom of a different staircase. Jack bumps onto a food table.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Tom gestures toward the hammock, and Lily glides to the hammock, then hops onto it. Lily hangs one arm along the edge of the hammock, rests her hand on the cushion behind her head, and taps her left hand near her nose. Grinning, Lily tilts her head and nibbles her nails. Tom squints over the top of his tablet, scribbles a curve, and, glancing from the screen to Lily, he doodles. Tom smirks as he scribbles, sweeps his pastel across the screen creating soft lines, nods his head to flick his hat out of his vision, and embellishes details as he refines the doodle. Tom grins as he emphasizes a line under Lily's necklace, while Lily watches Tom as he doodles. With his palm, Tom smudges various parts of the pastel drawing, including Lily's wrist, chin, and nose. Lily gazes blankly, and gradually, creases form around her cheeks, and she morphs into her elder version. The team members and Lily's nephew, Carrie, gaze at her, and Doug and Carrie swap grins. Tom initials and dates the doodle, then blows on it, snaps his tablet shut, and offers it to Lily. They hug. Later, Lily scrawls on a piece of parchment, and Tom approaches her. She offers him the pouch holding the Jewel of the Seas. Tom moves into the adjacent space and tucks the pouch into the trunk. In the elite cigar lounge, Harrison approaches Max, who leans, as the Lusitania drifts slowly. On the deck, the steerer turns the vessel's cylinder as a ship's officer walks to Commander Jenkins, who glances down as he flicks a slice of lime in his cider, then strolls off. Strolling back into Lily's chamber, he exhales on his hands, and donning an evening gown, Lily joins him. Lily snatches Tom and guides him through the parlor toward an exit. Harrison sneaks into the chamber as Lily and Tom rush into Lily's office, and Lily secures the exit. Harrison marches through the parlor as Tom and Lily slip through another exit into a hallway. Harrison charges into another space as Tom and Lily rush down the hallway. Harrison swings open an exit and spots Tom and Lily, who hasten, prompting Harrison to pursue them. Tom and Lily sprint to a lift, dart into the lift, and the attendant slides the mesh shut. Harrison jogs up to the lift and pounds his fists against the mesh, and as the lift lowers, Harrison scowls through glass at them. Lily extends her index, then salutes, and Harrison rushes to the escalator. The lift opens, and Lily and Tom tumble out as Harrison races down an escalator while Tom and Lily scurry from the base of a distinct escalator. Tom collides onto a fruit cart.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Jack gestures to the settee, where Rose reclines, posing for a sketch. Observing her intently, Jack draws, adding details and shading, while Rose watches him. As the scene shifts, Rose ages, revealing her older self surrounded by onlookers. Jack signs and hands the completed sketch to Rose, and they share a kiss. Rose writes a note and hands Jack the Heart of the Ocean case, which he secures in a safe. Meanwhile, Lovejoy searches for them on the Titanic, and Captain Smith is shown on the bridge. In Rose's suite, she and Jack evade Lovejoy by escaping through various rooms and corridors. Lovejoy pursues them, but they manage to enter an elevator, leaving Lovejoy behind. Rose mockingly waves at him as they descend, and when they reach the bottom, they emerge, bumping into a food table as they continue to flee.
